findings.title: Code Injection
findings.description: Use of exec() - code injection risk
findings.code_snippet:
55 |     def test_good_input(self, mock_write):
      56 |         code = self.trigger_func(self.good_input[0])
>>>   57 |         exec(code)
      58 |         assert mock_write.called
      59 |         assert mock_write.call_args_list[0][0][0] == "foo"
findings.recommendation: Never use eval() or exec() with user input. Use safe alternatives.

findings.title: Insecure Deserialization

findings.title: Advanced Deserialization Risk
findings.description: YAML load without SafeLoader - code execution risk
findings.code_snippet:
15 | def do_yaml_load(user_input):
      16 |     try:
>>>   17 |         return yaml.load(user_input, Loader=yaml.UnsafeLoader)
      18 |     except yaml.constructor.ConstructorError:
      19 |         pass
findings.recommendation: Never deserialize untrusted data. Use JSON or safe alternatives to pickle/yaml.load.

findings.title: Improper Privilege Management
findings.code_snippet:
47 |       - name: Install dependencies
      48 |         run: |
>>>   49 |           sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install libxml2-dev libxslt-dev
      50 |           python -m pip install --upgrade pip
      51 |           pip install tox
findings.recommendation: Follow principle of least privilege. Avoid running as root. Use proper permission checks.
